text: Model of MIP-1α transcriptional activation by HIV-1 Tat. (A) In absence of Tat, IκB-α occupies the NF-κB enhancer of the MIP-1α promoter and likely interacts with transcriptional repressors, such as HDACs (65), to inhibit gene transcription. (B) Tat activates the MIP-1α expression by removing the IκB-α repressor from the NF-κB enhancer, and by increasing the binding of p65 NF-κB complex to the NF-κB enhancer.
